verses.text: And there ran a young man, and told Moses, and said, Eldad and Medad do prophesy in the camp.

verses.name: Numbers 11:28
verses.text: And Joshua the son of Nun, the servant of Moses, one of his young men, answered and said, My lord Moses, forbid them.

verses.name: Numbers 11:29
verses.text: And Moses said unto him, Enviest thou for my sake? would God that all the Lord’s people were prophets, and that the Lord would put his spirit upon them!

verses.name: Numbers 11:30
verses.text: And Moses gat him into the camp, he and the elders of Israel.

verses.name: Numbers 11:31
verses.text: And there went forth a wind from the Lord, and brought quails from the sea, and let them fall by the camp, as it were a day’s journey on this side, and as it were a day’s journey on the other side, round about the camp, and as it were two cubits high upon the face of the earth.

verses.name: Numbers 11:32
verses.text: And the people stood up all that day, and all that night, and all the next day, and they gathered the quails: he that gathered least gathered ten homers: and they spread them all abroad for themselves round about the camp.

verses.name: Numbers 11:33
verses.text: And while the flesh was yet between their teeth, ere it was chewed, the wrath of the Lord was kindled against the people, and the Lord smote the people with a very great plague.

verses.name: Numbers 11:34
verses.text: And he called the name of that place Kibroth–hattaavah: because there they buried the people that lusted.

verses.name: Numbers 11:35
verses.text: And the people journeyed from Kibroth–hattaavah unto Hazeroth; and abode at Hazeroth.

verses.name: Numbers 12:1
verses.text: And Miriam and Aaron spake against Moses because of the Ethiopian woman whom he had married: for he had married an Ethiopian woman.

verses.name: Numbers 12:2
verses.text: And they said, Hath the Lord indeed spoken only by Moses? hath he not spoken also by us? And the Lord heard it.

verses.name: Numbers 12:3
verses.text: (Now the man Moses was very meek, above all the men which were upon the face of the earth.)

verses.name: Numbers 12:4
verses.text: And the Lord spake suddenly unto Moses, and unto Aaron, and unto Miriam, Come out ye three unto the tabernacle of the congregation. And they three came out.

verses.name: Numbers 12:5
verses.text: And the Lord came down in the pillar of the cloud, and stood in the door of the tabernacle, and called Aaron and Miriam: and they both came forth.

verses.name: Numbers 12:6
verses.text: And he said, Hear now my words: If there be a prophet among you, I the Lord will make myself known unto him in a vision, and will speak unto him in a dream.

verses.name: Numbers 12:7
verses.text: My servant Moses is not so, who is faithful in all mine house.

verses.name: Numbers 12:8
verses.text: With him will I speak mouth to mouth, even apparently, and not in dark speeches; and the similitude of the Lord shall he behold: wherefore then were ye not afraid to speak against my servant Moses?

verses.name: Numbers 12:9
verses.text: And the anger of the Lord was kindled against them; and he departed.

verses.name: Numbers 12:10
verses.text: And the cloud departed from off the tabernacle; and, behold, Miriam became leprous, white as snow: and Aaron looked upon Miriam, and, behold, she was leprous.

verses.name: Numbers 12:11
verses.text: And Aaron said unto Moses, Alas, my lord, I beseech thee, lay not the sin upon us, wherein we have done foolishly, and wherein we have sinned.

verses.name: Numbers 12:12
verses.text: Let her not be as one dead, of whom the flesh is half consumed when he cometh out of his mother’s womb.

verses.name: Numbers 12:13
verses.text: And Moses cried unto the Lord, saying, Heal her now, O God, I beseech thee.

verses.name: Numbers 12:14
verses.text: And the Lord said unto Moses, If her father had but spit in her face, should she not be ashamed seven days? let her be shut out from the camp seven days, and after that let her be received in again.

verses.name: Numbers 12:15
verses.text: And Miriam was shut out from the camp seven days: and the people journeyed not till Miriam was brought in again.

verses.name: Numbers 12:16
verses.text: And afterward the people removed from Hazeroth, and pitched in the wilderness of Paran.

verses.name: Numbers 13:1
verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,

verses.name: Numbers 13:2
verses.text: Send thou men, that they may search the land of Canaan, which I give unto the children of Israel: of every tribe of their fathers shall ye send a man, every one a ruler among them.

verses.name: Numbers 13:3
verses.text: And Moses by the commandment of the Lord sent them from the wilderness of Paran: all those men were heads of the children of Israel.

verses.name: Numbers 13:4
verses.text: And these were their names: of the tribe of Reuben, Shammua the son of Zaccur.

verses.name: Numbers 13:5
verses.text: Of the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat the son of Hori.

verses.name: Numbers 13:6
verses.text: Of the tribe of Judah, Caleb the son of Jephunneh.

verses.name: Numbers 13:7
verses.text: Of the tribe of Issachar, Igal the son of Joseph.

verses.name: Numbers 13:8
verses.text: Of the tribe of Ephraim, Oshea the son of Nun.

verses.name: Numbers 13:9
verses.text: Of the tribe of Benjamin, Palti the son of Raphu.

verses.name: Numbers 13:10
verses.text: Of the tribe of Zebulun, Gaddiel the son of Sodi.

verses.name: Numbers 13:11
verses.text: Of the tribe of Joseph, namely, of the tribe of Manasseh, Gaddi the son of Susi.

verses.name: Numbers 13:12
verses.text: Of the tribe of Dan, Ammiel the son of Gemalli.

verses.name: Numbers 13:13
verses.text: Of the tribe of Asher, Sethur the son of Michael.

verses.name: Numbers 13:14
verses.text: Of the tribe of Naphtali, Nahbi the son of Vophsi.

verses.name: Numbers 13:15
verses.text: Of the tribe of Gad, Geuel the son of Machi.

verses.name: Numbers 13:16
verses.text: These are the names of the men which Moses sent to spy out the land. And Moses called Oshea the son of Nun Jehoshua.

verses.name: Numbers 13:17
verses.text: And Moses sent them to spy out the land of Canaan, and said unto them, Get you up this way southward, and go up into the mountain:

verses.name: Numbers 13:18
verses.text: And see the land, what it is; and the people that dwelleth therein, whether they be strong or weak, few or many;

verses.name: Numbers 13:19
verses.text: And what the land is that they dwell in, whether it be good or bad; and what cities they be that they dwell in, whether in tents, or in strong holds;

verses.name: Numbers 13:20
verses.text: And what the land is, whether it be fat or lean, whether there be wood therein, or not. And be ye of good courage, and bring of the fruit of the land. Now the time was the time of the firstripe grapes.

verses.name: Numbers 13:21
verses.text: So they went up, and searched the land from the wilderness of Zin unto Rehob, as men come to Hamath.

verses.name: Numbers 13:22
verses.text: And they ascended by the south, and came unto Hebron; where Ahiman, Sheshai, and Talmai, the children of Anak, were. (Now Hebron was built seven years before Zoan in Egypt.)

verses.name: Numbers 13:23
verses.text: And they came unto the brook of Eshcol, and cut down from thence a branch with one cluster of grapes, and they bare it between two upon a staff; and they brought of the pomegranates, and of the figs.

verses.name: Numbers 13:24
verses.text: The place was called the brook Eshcol, because of the cluster of grapes which the children of Israel cut down from thence.

verses.name: Numbers 13:25
verses.text: And they returned from searching of the land after forty days.

verses.name: Numbers 13:26
verses.text: And they went and came to Moses, and to Aaron, and to all the congregation of the children of Israel, unto the wilderness of Paran, to Kadesh; and brought back word unto them, and unto all the congregation, and shewed them the fruit of the land.

verses.name: Numbers 13:27
verses.text: And they told him, and said, We came unto the land whither thou sentest us, and surely it floweth with milk and honey; and this is the fruit of it.

verses.name: Numbers 13:28
verses.text: Nevertheless the people be strong that dwell in the land, and the cities are walled, and very great: and moreover we saw the children of Anak there.

verses.name: Numbers 13:29
verses.text: The Amalekites dwell in the land of the south: and the Hittites, and the Jebusites, and the Amorites, dwell in the mountains: and the Canaanites dwell by the sea, and by the coast of Jordan.

verses.name: Numbers 13:30
verses.text: And Caleb stilled the people before Moses, and said, Let us go up at once, and possess it; for we are well able to overcome it.

verses.name: Numbers 13:31
verses.text: But the men that went up with him said, We be not able to go up against the people; for they are stronger than we.

verses.name: Numbers 13:32
verses.text: And they brought up an evil report of the land which they had searched unto the children of Israel, saying, The land, through which we have gone to search it, is a land that eateth up the inhabitants thereof; and all the people that we saw in it are men of a great stature.

verses.name: Numbers 13:33
verses.text: And there we saw the giants, the sons of Anak, which come of the giants: and we were in our own sight as grasshoppers, and so we were in their sight.

verses.name: Numbers 14:1
verses.text: And all the congregation lifted up their voice, and cried; and the people wept that night.

verses.name: Numbers 14:2
verses.text: And all the children of Israel murmured against Moses and against Aaron: and the whole congregation said unto them, Would God that we had died in the land of Egypt! or would God we had died in this wilderness!

verses.name: Numbers 14:3
verses.text: And wherefore hath the Lord brought us unto this land, to fall by the sword, that our wives and our children should be a prey? were it not better for us to return into Egypt?

verses.name: Numbers 14:4
verses.text: And they said one to another, Let us make a captain, and let us return into Egypt.

verses.name: Numbers 14:5
verses.text: Then Moses and Aaron fell on their faces before all the assembly of the congregation of the children of Israel.

verses.name: Numbers 14:6
verses.text: And Joshua the son of Nun, and Caleb the son of Jephunneh, which were of them that searched the land, rent their clothes:

verses.name: Numbers 14:7
verses.text: And they spake unto all the company of the children of Israel, saying, The land, which we passed through to search it, is an exceeding good land.

verses.name: Numbers 14:8
verses.text: If the Lord delight in us, then he will bring us into this land, and give it us; a land which floweth with milk and honey.

verses.name: Numbers 14:9
verses.text: Only rebel not ye against the Lord, neither fear ye the people of the land; for they are bread for us: their defence is departed from them, and the Lord is with us: fear them not.

verses.name: Numbers 14:10
verses.text: But all the congregation bade stone them with stones. And the glory of the Lord appeared in the tabernacle of the congregation before all the children of Israel.

verses.name: Numbers 14:11
verses.text: And the Lord said unto Moses, How long will this people provoke me? and how long will it be ere they believe me, for all the signs which I have shewed among them?

verses.name: Numbers 14:12
verses.text: I will smite them with the pestilence, and disinherit them, and will make of thee a greater nation and mightier than they.

verses.name: Numbers 14:13
verses.text: And Moses said unto the Lord, Then the Egyptians shall hear it, (for thou broughtest up this people in thy might from among them;)

verses.name: Numbers 14:14
verses.text: And they will tell it to the inhabitants of this land: for they have heard that thou Lord art among this people, that thou Lord art seen face to face, and that thy cloud standeth over them, and that thou goest before them, by day time in a pillar of a cloud, and in a pillar of fire by night.

verses.name: Numbers 14:15
verses.text: Now if thou shalt kill all this people as one man, then the nations which have heard the fame of thee will speak, saying,

verses.name: Numbers 14:16
verses.text: Because the Lord was not able to bring this people into the land which he sware unto them, therefore he hath slain them in the wilderness.

verses.name: Numbers 14:17
verses.text: And now, I beseech thee, let the power of my Lord be great, according as thou hast spoken, saying,

verses.name: Numbers 14:18
verses.text: The Lord is longsuffering, and of great mercy, forgiving iniquity and transgression, and by no means clearing the guilty, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children unto the third and fourth generation.

verses.name: Numbers 14:19
verses.text: Pardon, I beseech thee, the iniquity of this people according unto the greatness of thy mercy, and as thou hast forgiven this people, from Egypt even until now.

verses.name: Numbers 14:20
verses.text: And the Lord said, I have pardoned according to thy word:

verses.name: Numbers 14:21
verses.text: But as truly as I live, all the earth shall be filled with the glory of the Lord.

verses.name: Numbers 14:22
verses.text: Because all those men which have seen my glory, and my miracles, which I did in Egypt and in the wilderness, and have tempted me now these ten times, and have not hearkened to my voice;

verses.name: Numbers 14:23
verses.text: Surely they shall not see the land which I sware unto their fathers, neither shall any of them that provoked me see it:

verses.name: Numbers 14:24
verses.text: But my servant Caleb, because he had another spirit with him, and hath followed me fully, him will I bring into the land whereinto he went; and his seed shall possess it.

verses.name: Numbers 14:25
verses.text: (Now the Amalekites and the Canaanites dwelt in the valley.) To morrow turn you, and get you into the wilderness by the way of the Red sea.

verses.name: Numbers 14:26
verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying,

verses.name: Numbers 14:27
verses.text: How long shall I bear with this evil congregation, which murmur against me? I have heard the murmurings of the children of Israel, which they murmur against me.

verses.name: Numbers 14:28
verses.text: Say unto them, As truly as I live, saith the Lord, as ye have spoken in mine ears, so will I do to you:

verses.name: Numbers 14:29
verses.text: Your carcases shall fall in this wilderness; and all that were numbered of you, according to your whole number, from twenty years old and upward, which have murmured against me,

verses.name: Numbers 14:30
verses.text: Doubtless ye shall not come into the land, concerning which I sware to make you dwell therein, save Caleb the son of Jephunneh, and Joshua the son of Nun.

verses.name: Numbers 14:31
verses.text: But your little ones, which ye said should be a prey, them will I bring in, and they shall know the land which ye have despised.

verses.name: Numbers 14:32
verses.text: But as for you, your carcases, they shall fall in this wilderness.

verses.name: Numbers 14:33
verses.text: And your children shall wander in the wilderness forty years, and bear your whoredoms, until your carcases be wasted in the wilderness.

verses.name: Numbers 14:34
verses.text: After the number of the days in which ye searched the land, even forty days, each day for a year, shall ye bear your iniquities, even forty years, and ye shall know my breach of promise.

verses.name: Numbers 14:35
verses.text: I the Lord have said, I will surely do it unto all this evil congregation, that are gathered together against me: in this wilderness they shall be consumed, and there they shall die.

verses.name: Numbers 14:36
verses.text: And the men, which Moses sent to search the land, who returned, and made all the congregation to murmur against him, by bringing up a slander upon the land,

verses.name: Numbers 14:37
verses.text: Even those men that did bring up the evil report upon the land, died by the plague before the Lord.

verses.name: Numbers 14:38
verses.text: But Joshua the son of Nun, and Caleb the son of Jephunneh, which were of the men that went to search the land, lived still.

verses.name: Numbers 14:39
verses.text: And Moses told these sayings unto all the children of Israel: and the people mourned greatly.

verses.name: Numbers 14:40
verses.text: And they rose up early in the morning, and gat them up into the top of the mountain, saying, Lo, we be here, and will go up unto the place which the Lord hath promised: for we have sinned.

verses.name: Numbers 14:41
verses.text: And Moses said, Wherefore now do ye transgress the commandment of the Lord? but it shall not prosper.

verses.name: Numbers 14:42
verses.text: Go not up, for the Lord is not among you; that ye be not smitten before your enemies.

verses.name: Numbers 14:43
verses.text: For the Amalekites and the Canaanites are there before you, and ye shall fall by the sword: because ye are turned away from the Lord, therefore the Lord will not be with you.

verses.name: Numbers 14:44
verses.text: But they presumed to go up unto the hill top: nevertheless the ark of the covenant of the Lord, and Moses, departed not out of the camp.

verses.name: Numbers 14:45
verses.text: Then the Amalekites came down, and the Canaanites which dwelt in that hill, and smote them, and discomfited them, even unto Hormah.

verses.name: Numbers 15:1
verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,

verses.name: Numbers 15:2
verses.text: Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When ye be come into the land of your habitations, which I give unto you,

verses.name: Numbers 15:3
verses.text: And will make an offering by fire unto the Lord, a burnt offering, or a sacrifice in performing a vow, or in a freewill offering, or in your solemn feasts, to make a sweet savour unto the Lord, of the herd, or of the flock:

verses.name: Numbers 15:4
verses.text: Then shall he that offereth his offering unto the Lord bring a meat offering of a tenth deal of flour mingled with the fourth part of an hin of oil.

verses.name: Numbers 15:5
verses.text: And the fourth part of an hin of wine for a drink offering shalt thou prepare with the burnt offering or sacrifice, for one lamb.

verses.name: Numbers 15:6
verses.text: Or for a ram, thou shalt prepare for a meat offering two tenth deals of flour mingled with the third part of an hin of oil.

verses.name: Numbers 15:7
verses.text: And for a drink offering thou shalt offer the third part of an hin of wine, for a sweet savour unto the Lord.

verses.name: Numbers 15:8
verses.text: And when thou preparest a bullock for a burnt offering, or for a sacrifice in performing a vow, or peace offerings unto the Lord:

verses.name: Numbers 15:9
verses.text: Then shall he bring with a bullock a meat offering of three tenth deals of flour mingled with half an hin of oil.

verses.name: Numbers 15:10
verses.text: And thou shalt bring for a drink offering half an hin of wine, for an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the Lord.

verses.name: Numbers 15:11
verses.text: Thus shall it be done for one bullock, or for one ram, or for a lamb, or a kid.

verses.name: Numbers 15:12
verses.text: According to the number that ye shall prepare, so shall ye do to every one according to their number.

verses.name: Numbers 15:13
verses.text: All that are born of the country shall do these things after this manner, in offering an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the Lord.

verses.name: Numbers 15:14
verses.text: And if a stranger sojourn with you, or whosoever be among you in your generations, and will offer an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the Lord; as ye do, so he shall do.

verses.name: Numbers 15:15
verses.text: One ordinance shall be both for you of the congregation, and also for the stranger that sojourneth with you, an ordinance for ever in your generations: as ye are, so shall the stranger be before the Lord.

verses.name: Numbers 15:16
verses.text: One law and one manner shall be for you, and for the stranger that sojourneth with you.

verses.name: Numbers 15:17
verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,

verses.name: Numbers 15:18
verses.text: Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When ye come into the land whither I bring you,

verses.name: Numbers 15:19
verses.text: Then it shall be, that, when ye eat of the bread of the land, ye shall offer up an heave offering unto the Lord.

verses.name: Numbers 15:20
verses.text: Ye shall offer up a cake of the first of your dough for an heave offering: as ye do the heave offering of the threshingfloor, so shall ye heave it.

verses.name: Numbers 15:21
verses.text: Of the first of your dough ye shall give unto the Lord an heave offering in your generations.

verses.name: Numbers 15:22
verses.text: And if ye have erred, and not observed all these commandments, which the Lord hath spoken unto Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 15:23
verses.text: Even all that the Lord hath commanded you by the hand of Moses, from the day that the Lord commanded Moses, and henceforward among your generations;

verses.name: Numbers 15:24
verses.text: Then it shall be, if ought be committed by ignorance without the knowledge of the congregation, that all the congregation shall offer one young bullock for a burnt offering, for a sweet savour unto the Lord, with his meat offering, and his drink offering, according to the manner, and one kid of the goats for a sin offering.

verses.name: Numbers 15:25
verses.text: And the priest shall make an atonement for all the congregation of the children of Israel, and it shall be forgiven them; for it is ignorance: and they shall bring their offering, a sacrifice made by fire unto the Lord, and their sin offering before the Lord, for their ignorance:

verses.name: Numbers 15:26
verses.text: And it shall be forgiven all the congregation of the children of Israel, and the stranger that sojourneth among them; seeing all the people were in ignorance.

verses.name: Numbers 15:27
verses.text: And if any soul sin through ignorance, then he shall bring a she goat of the first year for a sin offering.

verses.name: Numbers 15:28
verses.text: And the priest shall make an atonement for the soul that sinneth ignorantly, when he sinneth by ignorance before the Lord, to make an atonement for him; and it shall be forgiven him.

verses.name: Numbers 15:29
verses.text: Ye shall have one law for him that sinneth through ignorance, both for him that is born among the children of Israel, and for the stranger that sojourneth among them.

verses.name: Numbers 15:30
verses.text: But the soul that doeth ought presumptuously, whether he be born in the land, or a stranger, the same reproacheth the Lord; and that soul shall be cut off from among his people.

verses.name: Numbers 15:31
verses.text: Because he hath despised the word of the Lord, and hath broken his commandment, that soul shall utterly be cut off; his iniquity shall be upon him.

verses.name: Numbers 15:32
verses.text: And while the children of Israel were in the wilderness, they found a man that gathered sticks upon the sabbath day.

verses.name: Numbers 15:33
verses.text: And they that found him gathering sticks brought him unto Moses and Aaron, and unto all the congregation.

verses.name: Numbers 15:34
verses.text: And they put him in ward, because it was not declared what should be done to him.

verses.name: Numbers 15:35
verses.text: And the Lord said unto Moses, The man shall be surely put to death: all the congregation shall stone him with stones without the camp.

verses.name: Numbers 15:36
verses.text: And all the congregation brought him without the camp, and stoned him with stones, and he died; as the Lord commanded Moses.

verses.name: Numbers 15:37
verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,

verses.name: Numbers 15:38
verses.text: Speak unto the children of Israel, and bid them that they make them fringes in the borders of their garments throughout their generations, and that they put upon the fringe of the borders a ribband of blue:

verses.name: Numbers 15:39
verses.text: And it shall be unto you for a fringe, that ye may look upon it, and remember all the commandments of the Lord, and do them; and that ye seek not after your own heart and your own eyes, after which ye use to go a whoring:

verses.name: Numbers 15:40
verses.text: That ye may remember, and do all my commandments, and be holy unto your God.

verses.name: Numbers 15:41
verses.text: I am the Lord your God, which brought you out of the land of Egypt, to be your God: I am the Lord your God.

verses.name: Numbers 16:1
verses.text: Now Korah, the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, and Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab, and On, the son of Peleth, sons of Reuben, took men:

verses.name: Numbers 16:2
verses.text: And they rose up before Moses, with certain of the children of Israel, two hundred and fifty princes of the assembly, famous in the congregation, men of renown:

verses.name: Numbers 16:3
verses.text: And they gathered themselves together against Moses and against Aaron, and said unto them, Ye take too much upon you, seeing all the congregation are holy, every one of them, and the Lord is among them: wherefore then lift ye up yourselves above the congregation of the Lord?

verses.name: Numbers 16:4
verses.text: And when Moses heard it, he fell upon his face:

verses.name: Numbers 16:5
verses.text: And he spake unto Korah and unto all his company, saying, Even to morrow the Lord will shew who are his, and who is holy; and will cause him to come near unto him: even him whom he hath chosen will he cause to come near unto him.

verses.name: Numbers 16:6
verses.text: This do; Take you censers, Korah, and all his company;

verses.name: Numbers 16:7
verses.text: And put fire therein, and put incense in them before the Lord to morrow: and it shall be that the man whom the Lord doth choose, he shall be holy: ye take too much upon you, ye sons of Levi.

verses.name: Numbers 16:8
verses.text: And Moses said unto Korah, Hear, I pray you, ye sons of Levi:

verses.name: Numbers 16:9
verses.text: Seemeth it but a small thing unto you, that the God of Israel hath separated you from the congregation of Israel, to bring you near to himself to do the service of the tabernacle of the Lord, and to stand before the congregation to minister unto them?

verses.name: Numbers 16:10
verses.text: And he hath brought thee near to him, and all thy brethren the sons of Levi with thee: and seek ye the priesthood also?

verses.name: Numbers 16:11
verses.text: For which cause both thou and all thy company are gathered together against the Lord: and what is Aaron, that ye murmur against him?

verses.name: Numbers 16:12
verses.text: And Moses sent to call Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab: which said, We will not come up:

verses.name: Numbers 16:13
verses.text: Is it a small thing that thou hast brought us up out of a land that floweth with milk and honey, to kill us in the wilderness, except thou make thyself altogether a prince over us?

verses.name: Numbers 16:14
verses.text: Moreover thou hast not brought us into a land that floweth with milk and honey, or given us inheritance of fields and vineyards: wilt thou put out the eyes of these men? we will not come up.

verses.name: Numbers 16:15
verses.text: And Moses was very wroth, and said unto the Lord, Respect not thou their offering: I have not taken one ass from them, neither have I hurt one of them.

verses.name: Numbers 16:16
verses.text: And Moses said unto Korah, Be thou and all thy company before the Lord, thou, and they, and Aaron, to morrow:

verses.name: Numbers 16:17
verses.text: And take every man his censer, and put incense in them, and bring ye before the Lord every man his censer, two hundred and fifty censers; thou also, and Aaron, each of you his censer.

verses.name: Numbers 16:18
verses.text: And they took every man his censer, and put fire in them, and laid incense thereon, and stood in the door of the tabernacle of the congregation with Moses and Aaron.

verses.name: Numbers 16:19
verses.text: And Korah gathered all the congregation against them unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation: and the glory of the Lord appeared unto all the congregation.

verses.name: Numbers 16:20
verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying,

verses.name: Numbers 16:21
verses.text: Separate yourselves from among this congregation, that I may consume them in a moment.

verses.name: Numbers 16:22
verses.text: And they fell upon their faces, and said, O God, the God of the spirits of all flesh, shall one man sin, and wilt thou be wroth with all the congregation?

verses.name: Numbers 16:23
verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,

verses.name: Numbers 16:24
verses.text: Speak unto the congregation, saying, Get you up from about the tabernacle of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram.

verses.name: Numbers 16:25
verses.text: And Moses rose up and went unto Dathan and Abiram; and the elders of Israel followed him.

verses.name: Numbers 16:26
verses.text: And he spake unto the congregation, saying, Depart, I pray you, from the tents of these wicked men, and touch nothing of theirs, lest ye be consumed in all their sins.

verses.name: Numbers 16:27
verses.text: So they gat up from the tabernacle of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram, on every side: and Dathan and Abiram came out, and stood in the door of their tents, and their wives, and their sons, and their little children.

verses.name: Numbers 16:28
verses.text: And Moses said, Hereby ye shall know that the Lord hath sent me to do all these works; for I have not done them of mine own mind.

verses.name: Numbers 16:29
verses.text: If these men die the common death of all men, or if they be visited after the visitation of all men; then the Lord hath not sent me.

verses.name: Numbers 16:30
verses.text: But if the Lord make a new thing, and the earth open her mouth, and swallow them up, with all that appertain unto them, and they go down quick into the pit; then ye shall understand that these men have provoked the Lord.

verses.name: Numbers 16:31
verses.text: And it came to pass, as he had made an end of speaking all these words, that the ground clave asunder that was under them:

verses.name: Numbers 16:32
verses.text: And the earth opened her mouth, and swallowed them up, and their houses, and all the men that appertained unto Korah, and all their goods.

verses.name: Numbers 16:33
verses.text: They, and all that appertained to them, went down alive into the pit, and the earth closed upon them: and they perished from among the congregation.

verses.name: Numbers 16:34
verses.text: And all Israel that were round about them fled at the cry of them: for they said, Lest the earth swallow us up also.

verses.name: Numbers 16:35
verses.text: And there came out a fire from the Lord, and consumed the two hundred and fifty men that offered incense.

verses.name: Numbers 16:36
verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,

verses.name: Numbers 16:37
verses.text: Speak unto Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest, that he take up the censers out of the burning, and scatter thou the fire yonder; for they are hallowed.

verses.name: Numbers 16:38
verses.text: The censers of these sinners against their own souls, let them make them broad plates for a covering of the altar: for they offered them before the Lord, therefore they are hallowed: and they shall be a sign unto the children of Israel.

verses.name: Numbers 16:39
verses.text: And Eleazar the priest took the brasen censers, wherewith they that were burnt had offered; and they were made broad plates for a covering of the altar:

verses.name: Numbers 16:40
verses.text: To be a memorial unto the children of Israel, that no stranger, which is not of the seed of Aaron, come near to offer incense before the Lord; that he be not as Korah, and as his company: as the Lord said to him by the hand of Moses.

verses.name: Numbers 16:41
verses.text: But on the morrow all the congregation of the children of Israel murmured against Moses and against Aaron, saying, Ye have killed the people of the Lord.

verses.name: Numbers 16:42
verses.text: And it came to pass, when the congregation was gathered against Moses and against Aaron, that they looked toward the tabernacle of the congregation: and, behold, the cloud covered it, and the glory of the Lord appeared.

verses.name: Numbers 16:43
verses.text: And Moses and Aaron came before the tabernacle of the congregation.

verses.name: Numbers 16:44
verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,

verses.name: Numbers 16:45
verses.text: Get you up from among this congregation, that I may consume them as in a moment. And they fell upon their faces.

verses.name: Numbers 16:46
verses.text: And Moses said unto Aaron, Take a censer, and put fire therein from off the altar, and put on incense, and go quickly unto the congregation, and make an atonement for them: for there is wrath gone out from the Lord; the plague is begun.

verses.name: Numbers 16:47
verses.text: And Aaron took as Moses commanded, and ran into the midst of the congregation; and, behold, the plague was begun among the people: and he put on incense, and made an atonement for the people.

verses.name: Numbers 16:48
verses.text: And he stood between the dead and the living; and the plague was stayed.

verses.name: Numbers 16:49
verses.text: Now they that died in the plague were fourteen thousand and seven hundred, beside them that died about the matter of Korah.

verses.name: Numbers 16:50
verses.text: And Aaron returned unto Moses unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation: and the plague was stayed.

verses.name: Numbers 17:1
verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,

verses.name: Numbers 17:2
verses.text: Speak unto the children of Israel, and take of every one of them a rod according to the house of their fathers, of all their princes according to the house of their fathers twelve rods: write thou every man’s name upon his rod.

verses.name: Numbers 17:3
verses.text: And thou shalt write Aaron’s name upon the rod of Levi: for one rod shall be for the head of the house of their fathers.

verses.name: Numbers 17:4
verses.text: And thou shalt lay them up in the tabernacle of the congregation before the testimony, where I will meet with you.

verses.name: Numbers 17:5
verses.text: And it shall come to pass, that the man’s rod, whom I shall choose, shall blossom: and I will make to cease from me the murmurings of the children of Israel, whereby they murmur against you.

verses.name: Numbers 17:6
verses.text: And Moses spake unto the children of Israel, and every one of their princes gave him a rod apiece, for each prince one, according to their fathers’ houses, even twelve rods: and the rod of Aaron was among their rods.

verses.name: Numbers 17:7
verses.text: And Moses laid up the rods before the Lord in the tabernacle of witness.

verses.name: Numbers 17:8
verses.text: And it came to pass, that on the morrow Moses went into the tabernacle of witness; and, behold, the rod of Aaron for the house of Levi was budded, and brought forth buds, and bloomed blossoms, and yielded almonds.

verses.name: Numbers 17:9
verses.text: And Moses brought out all the rods from before the Lord unto all the children of Israel: and they looked, and took every man his rod.

verses.name: Numbers 17:10
verses.text: And the Lord said unto Moses, Bring Aaron’s rod again before the testimony, to be kept for a token against the rebels; and thou shalt quite take away their murmurings from me, that they die not.

verses.name: Numbers 17:11
verses.text: And Moses did so: as the Lord commanded him, so did he.

verses.name: Numbers 17:12
verses.text: And the children of Israel spake unto Moses, saying, Behold, we die, we perish, we all perish.

verses.name: Numbers 17:13
verses.text: Whosoever cometh any thing near unto the tabernacle of the Lord shall die: shall we be consumed with dying?

verses.name: Numbers 18:1
verses.text: And the Lord said unto Aaron, Thou and thy sons and thy father’s house with thee shall bear the iniquity of the sanctuary: and thou and thy sons with thee shall bear the iniquity of your priesthood.

verses.name: Numbers 18:2
verses.text: And thy brethren also of the tribe of Levi, the tribe of thy father, bring thou with thee, that they may be joined unto thee, and minister unto thee: but thou and thy sons with thee shall minister before the tabernacle of witness.

verses.name: Numbers 18:3
verses.text: And they shall keep thy charge, and the charge of all the tabernacle: only they shall not come nigh the vessels of the sanctuary and the altar, that neither they, nor ye also, die.

verses.name: Numbers 18:4
verses.text: And they shall be joined unto thee, and keep the charge of the tabernacle of the congregation, for all the service of the tabernacle: and a stranger shall not come nigh unto you.

verses.name: Numbers 18:5
verses.text: And ye shall keep the charge of the sanctuary, and the charge of the altar: that there be no wrath any more upon the children of Israel.

verses.name: Numbers 18:6
verses.text: And I, behold, I have taken your brethren the Levites from among the children of Israel: to you they are given as a gift for the Lord, to do the service of the tabernacle of the congregation.

verses.name: Numbers 18:7
verses.text: Therefore thou and thy sons with thee shall keep your priest’s office for every thing of the altar, and within the vail; and ye shall serve: I have given your priest’s office unto you as a service of gift: and the stranger that cometh nigh shall be put to death.

verses.name: Numbers 18:8
verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Aaron, Behold, I also have given thee the charge of mine heave offerings of all the hallowed things of the children of Israel; unto thee have I given them by reason of the anointing, and to thy sons, by an ordinance for ever.

verses.name: Numbers 18:9
verses.text: This shall be thine of the most holy things, reserved from the fire: every oblation of theirs, every meat offering of theirs, and every sin offering of theirs, and every trespass offering of theirs, which they shall render unto me, shall be most holy for thee and for thy sons.

verses.name: Numbers 18:10
verses.text: In the most holy place shalt thou eat it; every male shall eat it: it shall be holy unto thee.

verses.name: Numbers 18:11
verses.text: And this is thine; the heave offering of their gift, with all the wave offerings of the children of Israel: I have given them unto thee, and to thy sons and to thy daughters with thee, by a statute for ever: every one that is clean in thy house shall eat of it.

verses.name: Numbers 18:12
verses.text: All the best of the oil, and all the best of the wine, and of the wheat, the firstfruits of them which they shall offer unto the Lord, them have I given thee.

verses.name: Numbers 18:13
verses.text: And whatsoever is first ripe in the land, which they shall bring unto the Lord, shall be thine; every one that is clean in thine house shall eat of it.

verses.name: Numbers 18:14
verses.text: Every thing devoted in Israel shall be thine.

verses.name: Numbers 18:15
verses.text: Every thing that openeth the matrix in all flesh, which they bring unto the Lord, whether it be of men or beasts, shall be thine: nevertheless the firstborn of man shalt thou surely redeem, and the firstling of unclean beasts shalt thou redeem.

verses.name: Numbers 18:16
verses.text: And those that are to be redeemed from a month old shalt thou redeem, according to thine estimation, for the money of five shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary, which is twenty gerahs.

verses.name: Numbers 18:17
verses.text: But the firstling of a cow, or the firstling of a sheep, or the firstling of a goat, thou shalt not redeem; they are holy: thou shalt sprinkle their blood upon the altar, and shalt burn their fat for an offering made by fire, for a sweet savour unto the Lord.

verses.name: Numbers 18:18
verses.text: And the flesh of them shall be thine, as the wave breast and as the right shoulder are thine.

verses.name: Numbers 18:19
verses.text: All the heave offerings of the holy things, which the children of Israel offer unto the Lord, have I given thee, and thy sons and thy daughters with thee, by a statute for ever: it is a covenant of salt for ever before the Lord unto thee and to thy seed with thee.

verses.name: Numbers 18:20
verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Aaron, Thou shalt have no inheritance in their land, neither shalt thou have any part among them: I am thy part and thine inheritance among the children of Israel.

verses.name: Numbers 18:21
verses.text: And, behold, I have given the children of Levi all the tenth in Israel for an inheritance, for their service which they serve, even the service of the tabernacle of the congregation.

verses.name: Numbers 18:22
verses.text: Neither must the children of Israel henceforth come nigh the tabernacle of the congregation, lest they bear sin, and die.

verses.name: Numbers 18:23
verses.text: But the Levites shall do the service of the tabernacle of the congregation, and they shall bear their iniquity: it shall be a statute for ever throughout your generations, that among the children of Israel they have no inheritance.

verses.name: Numbers 18:24
verses.text: But the tithes of the children of Israel, which they offer as an heave offering unto the Lord, I have given to the Levites to inherit: therefore I have said unto them, Among the children of Israel they shall have no inheritance.

verses.name: Numbers 18:25
verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,

verses.name: Numbers 18:26
verses.text: Thus speak unto the Levites, and say unto them, When ye take of the children of Israel the tithes which I have given you from them for your inheritance, then ye shall offer up an heave offering of it for the Lord, even a tenth part of the tithe.

verses.name: Numbers 18:27
verses.text: And this your heave offering shall be reckoned unto you, as though it were the corn of the threshingfloor, and as the fulness of the winepress.

verses.name: Numbers 18:28
verses.text: Thus ye also shall offer an heave offering unto the Lord of all your tithes, which ye receive of the children of Israel; and ye shall give thereof the Lord’s heave offering to Aaron the priest.

verses.name: Numbers 18:29
verses.text: Out of all your gifts ye shall offer every heave offering of the Lord, of all the best thereof, even the hallowed part thereof out of it.

verses.name: Numbers 18:30
verses.text: Therefore thou shalt say unto them, When ye have heaved the best thereof from it, then it shall be counted unto the Levites as the increase of the threshingfloor, and as the increase of the winepress.

verses.name: Numbers 18:31
verses.text: And ye shall eat it in every place, ye and your households: for it is your reward for your service in the tabernacle of the congregation.

verses.name: Numbers 18:32
verses.text: And ye shall bear no sin by reason of it, when ye have heaved from it the best of it: neither shall ye pollute the holy things of the children of Israel, lest ye die.

verses.name: Numbers 19:1
verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying,

verses.name: Numbers 19:2
verses.text: This is the ordinance of the law which the Lord hath commanded, saying, Speak unto the children of Israel, that they bring thee a red heifer without spot, wherein is no blemish, and upon which never came yoke:

verses.name: Numbers 19:3
verses.text: And ye shall give her unto Eleazar the priest, that he may bring her forth without the camp, and one shall slay her before his face:

verses.name: Numbers 19:4
verses.text: And Eleazar the priest shall take of her blood with his finger, and sprinkle of her blood directly before the tabernacle of the congregation seven times:

verses.name: Numbers 19:5
verses.text: And one shall burn the heifer in his sight; her skin, and her flesh, and her blood, with her dung, shall he burn:

verses.name: Numbers 19:6
verses.text: And the priest shall take cedar wood, and hyssop, and scarlet, and cast it into the midst of the burning of the heifer.

verses.name: Numbers 19:7
verses.text: Then the priest shall wash his clothes, and he shall bathe his flesh in water, and afterward he shall come into the camp, and the priest shall be unclean until the even.

verses.name: Numbers 19:8
verses.text: And he that burneth her shall wash his clothes in water, and bathe his flesh in water, and shall be unclean until the even.

verses.name: Numbers 19:9
verses.text: And a man that is clean shall gather up the ashes of the heifer, and lay them up without the camp in a clean place, and it shall be kept for the congregation of the children of Israel for a water of separation: it is a purification for sin.

verses.name: Numbers 19:10
verses.text: And he that gathereth the ashes of the heifer shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the even: and it shall be unto the children of Israel, and unto the stranger that sojourneth among them, for a statute for ever.

verses.name: Numbers 19:11
verses.text: He that toucheth the dead body of any man shall be unclean seven days.

verses.name: Numbers 19:12
verses.text: He shall purify himself with it on the third day, and on the seventh day he shall be clean: but if he purify not himself the third day, then the seventh day he shall not be clean.

verses.name: Numbers 19:13
verses.text: Whosoever toucheth the dead body of any man that is dead, and purifieth not himself, defileth the tabernacle of the Lord; and that soul shall be cut off from Israel: because the water of separation was not sprinkled upon him, he shall be unclean; his uncleanness is yet upon him.

verses.name: Numbers 19:14
verses.text: This is the law, when a man dieth in a tent: all that come into the tent, and all that is in the tent, shall be unclean seven days.

verses.name: Numbers 19:15
verses.text: And every open vessel, which hath no covering bound upon it, is unclean.

verses.name: Numbers 19:16
verses.text: And whosoever toucheth one that is slain with a sword in the open fields, or a dead body, or a bone of a man, or a grave, shall be unclean seven days.

verses.name: Numbers 19:17
verses.text: And for an unclean person they shall take of the ashes of the burnt heifer of purification for sin, and running water shall be put thereto in a vessel:

verses.name: Numbers 19:18
verses.text: And a clean person shall take hyssop, and dip it in the water, and sprinkle it upon the tent, and upon all the vessels, and upon the persons that were there, and upon him that touched a bone, or one slain, or one dead, or a grave:

verses.name: Numbers 19:19
verses.text: And the clean person shall sprinkle upon the unclean on the third day, and on the seventh day: and on the seventh day he shall purify himself, and wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and shall be clean at even.

verses.name: Numbers 19:20
verses.text: But the man that shall be unclean, and shall not purify himself, that soul shall be cut off from among the congregation, because he hath defiled the sanctuary of the Lord: the water of separation hath not been sprinkled upon him; he is unclean.

verses.name: Numbers 19:21
verses.text: And it shall be a perpetual statute unto them, that he that sprinkleth the water of separation shall wash his clothes; and he that toucheth the water of separation shall be unclean until even.

verses.name: Numbers 19:22
verses.text: And whatsoever the unclean person toucheth shall be unclean; and the soul that toucheth it shall be unclean until even.

verses.name: Numbers 20:1
verses.text: Then came the children of Israel, even the whole congregation, into the desert of Zin in the first month: and the people abode in Kadesh; and Miriam died there, and was buried there.

verses.name: Numbers 20:2
verses.text: And there was no water for the congregation: and they gathered themselves together against Moses and against Aaron.

verses.name: Numbers 20:3
verses.text: And the people chode with Moses, and spake, saying, Would God that we had died when our brethren died before the Lord!

verses.name: Numbers 20:4
verses.text: And why have ye brought up the congregation of the Lord into this wilderness, that we and our cattle should die there?

verses.name: Numbers 20:5
verses.text: And wherefore have ye made us to come up out of Egypt, to bring us in unto this evil place? it is no place of seed, or of figs, or of vines, or of pomegranates; neither is there any water to drink.

verses.name: Numbers 20:6
verses.text: And Moses and Aaron went from the presence of the assembly unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and they fell upon their faces: and the glory of the Lord appeared unto them.

verses.name: Numbers 20:7
verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,

verses.name: Numbers 20:8
verses.text: Take the rod, and gather thou the assembly together, thou, and Aaron thy brother, and speak ye unto the rock before their eyes; and it shall give forth his water, and thou shalt bring forth to them water out of the rock: so thou shalt give the congregation and their beasts drink.

verses.name: Numbers 20:9
verses.text: And Moses took the rod from before the Lord, as he commanded him.

verses.name: Numbers 20:10
verses.text: And Moses and Aaron gathered the congregation together before the rock, and he said unto them, Hear now, ye rebels; must we fetch you water out of this rock?

verses.name: Numbers 20:11
verses.text: And Moses lifted up his hand, and with his rod he smote the rock twice: and the water came out abundantly, and the congregation drank, and their beasts also.

verses.name: Numbers 20:12
verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses and Aaron, Because ye believed me not, to sanctify me in the eyes of the children of Israel, therefore ye shall not bring this congregation into the land which I have given them.

verses.name: Numbers 20:13
verses.text: This is the water of Meribah; because the children of Israel strove with the Lord, and he was sanctified in them.

verses.name: Numbers 20:14
verses.text: And Moses sent messengers from Kadesh unto the king of Edom, Thus saith thy brother Israel, Thou knowest all the travail that hath befallen us:

verses.name: Numbers 20:15
verses.text: How our fathers went down into Egypt, and we have dwelt in Egypt a long time; and the Egyptians vexed us, and our fathers:

verses.name: Numbers 20:16
verses.text: And when we cried unto the Lord, he heard our voice, and sent an angel, and hath brought us forth out of Egypt: and, behold, we are in Kadesh, a city in the uttermost of thy border:

verses.name: Numbers 20:17
verses.text: Let us pass, I pray thee, through thy country: we will not pass through the fields, or through the vineyards, neither will we drink of the water of the wells: we will go by the king’s high way, we will not turn to the right hand nor to the left, until we have passed thy borders.

verses.name: Numbers 20:18
verses.text: And Edom said unto him, Thou shalt not pass by me, lest I come out against thee with the sword.

verses.name: Numbers 20:19
verses.text: And the children of Israel said unto him, We will go by the high way: and if I and my cattle drink of thy water, then I will pay for it: I will only, without doing any thing else, go through on my feet.

verses.name: Numbers 20:20
verses.text: And he said, Thou shalt not go through. And Edom came out against him with much people, and with a strong hand.

verses.name: Numbers 20:21
verses.text: Thus Edom refused to give Israel passage through his border: wherefore Israel turned away from him.

verses.name: Numbers 20:22
verses.text: And the children of Israel, even the whole congregation, journeyed from Kadesh, and came unto mount Hor.

verses.name: Numbers 20:23
verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses and Aaron in mount Hor, by the coast of the land of Edom, saying,

verses.name: Numbers 20:24
verses.text: Aaron shall be gathered unto his people: for he shall not enter into the land which I have given unto the children of Israel, because ye rebelled against my word at the water of Meribah.

verses.name: Numbers 20:25
verses.text: Take Aaron and Eleazar his son, and bring them up unto mount Hor:

verses.name: Numbers 20:26
verses.text: And strip Aaron of his garments, and put them upon Eleazar his son: and Aaron shall be gathered unto his people, and shall die there.

verses.name: Numbers 20:27
verses.text: And Moses did as the Lord commanded: and they went up into mount Hor in the sight of all the congregation.

verses.name: Numbers 20:28
verses.text: And Moses stripped Aaron of his garments, and put them upon Eleazar his son; and Aaron died there in the top of the mount: and Moses and Eleazar came down from the mount.

verses.name: Numbers 20:29
verses.text: And when all the congregation saw that Aaron was dead, they mourned for Aaron thirty days, even all the house of Israel.

verses.name: Numbers 21:1
verses.text: And when king Arad the Canaanite, which dwelt in the south, heard tell that Israel came by the way of the spies; then he fought against Israel, and took some of them prisoners.

verses.name: Numbers 21:2
verses.text: And Israel vowed a vow unto the Lord, and said, If thou wilt indeed deliver this people into my hand, then I will utterly destroy their cities.

verses.name: Numbers 21:3
verses.text: And the Lord hearkened to the voice of Israel, and delivered up the Canaanites; and they utterly destroyed them and their cities: and he called the name of the place Hormah.

verses.name: Numbers 21:4
verses.text: And they journeyed from mount Hor by the way of the Red sea, to compass the land of Edom: and the soul of the people was much discouraged because of the way.

verses.name: Numbers 21:5
verses.text: And the people spake against God, and against Moses, Wherefore have ye brought us up out of Egypt to die in the wilderness? for there is no bread, neither is there any water; and our soul loatheth this light bread.

verses.name: Numbers 21:6
verses.text: And the Lord sent fiery serpents among the people, and they bit the people; and much people of Israel died.

verses.name: Numbers 21:7
verses.text: Therefore the people came to Moses, and said, We have sinned, for we have spoken against the Lord, and against thee; pray unto the Lord, that he take away the serpents from us. And Moses prayed for the people.

verses.name: Numbers 21:8
verses.text: And the Lord said unto Moses, Make thee a fiery serpent, and set it upon a pole: and it shall come to pass, that every one that is bitten, when he looketh upon it, shall live.

verses.name: Numbers 21:9
verses.text: And Moses made a serpent of brass, and put it upon a pole, and it came to pass, that if a serpent had bitten any man, when he beheld the serpent of brass, he lived.

verses.name: Numbers 21:10
verses.text: And the children of Israel set forward, and pitched in Oboth.

verses.name: Numbers 21:11
verses.text: And they journeyed from Oboth, and pitched at Ije–abarim, in the wilderness which is before Moab, toward the sunrising.

verses.name: Numbers 21:12
verses.text: From thence they removed, and pitched in the valley of Zared.

verses.name: Numbers 21:13
verses.text: From thence they removed, and pitched on the other side of Arnon, which is in the wilderness that cometh out of the coasts of the Amorites: for Arnon is the border of Moab, between Moab and the Amorites.

verses.name: Numbers 21:14
verses.text: Wherefore it is said in the book of the wars of the Lord, What he did in the Red sea, and in the brooks of Arnon,

verses.name: Numbers 21:15
verses.text: And at the stream of the brooks that goeth down to the dwelling of Ar, and lieth upon the border of Moab.

verses.name: Numbers 21:16
verses.text: And from thence they went to Beer: that is the well whereof the Lord spake unto Moses, Gather the people together, and I will give them water.

verses.name: Numbers 21:17
verses.text: Then Israel sang this song, Spring up, O well; sing ye unto it:

verses.name: Numbers 21:18
verses.text: The princes digged the well, the nobles of the people digged it, by the direction of the lawgiver, with their staves. And from the wilderness they went to Mattanah:

verses.name: Numbers 21:19
verses.text: And from Mattanah to Nahaliel: and from Nahaliel to Bamoth:

verses.name: Numbers 21:20
verses.text: And from Bamoth in the valley, that is in the country of Moab, to the top of Pisgah, which looketh toward Jeshimon.

verses.name: Numbers 21:21
verses.text: And Israel sent messengers unto Sihon king of the Amorites, saying,

verses.name: Numbers 21:22
verses.text: Let me pass through thy land: we will not turn into the fields, or into the vineyards; we will not drink of the waters of the well: but we will go along by the king’s high way, until we be past thy borders.

verses.name: Numbers 21:23
verses.text: And Sihon would not suffer Israel to pass through his border: but Sihon gathered all his people together, and went out against Israel into the wilderness: and he came to Jahaz, and fought against Israel.

verses.name: Numbers 21:24
verses.text: And Israel smote him with the edge of the sword, and possessed his land from Arnon unto Jabbok, even unto the children of Ammon: for the border of the children of Ammon was strong.

verses.name: Numbers 21:25
verses.text: And Israel took all these cities: and Israel dwelt in all the cities of the Amorites, in Heshbon, and in all the villages thereof.

verses.name: Numbers 21:26
verses.text: For Heshbon was the city of Sihon the king of the Amorites, who had fought against the former king of Moab, and taken all his land out of his hand, even unto Arnon.

verses.name: Numbers 21:27
verses.text: Wherefore they that speak in proverbs say, Come into Heshbon, let the city of Sihon be built and prepared:

verses.name: Numbers 21:28
verses.text: For there is a fire gone out of Heshbon, a flame from the city of Sihon: it hath consumed Ar of Moab, and the lords of the high places of Arnon.

verses.name: Numbers 21:29
verses.text: Woe to thee, Moab! thou art undone, O people of Chemosh: he hath given his sons that escaped, and his daughters, into captivity unto Sihon king of the Amorites.

verses.name: Numbers 21:30
verses.text: We have shot at them; Heshbon is perished even unto Dibon, and we have laid them waste even unto Nophah, which reacheth unto Medeba.

verses.name: Numbers 21:31
verses.text: Thus Israel dwelt in the land of the Amorites.

verses.name: Numbers 21:32
verses.text: And Moses sent to spy out Jaazer, and they took the villages thereof, and drove out the Amorites that were there.

verses.name: Numbers 21:33
verses.text: And they turned and went up by the way of Bashan: and Og the king of Bashan went out against them, he, and all his people, to the battle at Edrei.

verses.name: Numbers 21:34
verses.text: And the Lord said unto Moses, Fear him not: for I have delivered him into thy hand, and all his people, and his land; and thou shalt do to him as thou didst unto Sihon king of the Amorites, which dwelt at Heshbon.

verses.name: Numbers 21:35
verses.text: So they smote him, and his sons, and all his people, until there was none left him alive: and they possessed his land.

verses.name: Numbers 22:1
verses.text: And the children of Israel set forward, and pitched in the plains of Moab on this side Jordan by Jericho.

verses.name: Numbers 22:2
verses.text: And Balak the son of Zippor saw all that Israel had done to the Amorites.

verses.name: Numbers 22:3
verses.text: And Moab was sore afraid of the people, because they were many: and Moab was distressed because of the children of Israel.

verses.name: Numbers 22:4
verses.text: And Moab said unto the elders of Midian, Now shall this company lick up all that are round about us, as the ox licketh up the grass of the field. And Balak the son of Zippor was king of the Moabites at that time.

verses.name: Numbers 22:5
verses.text: He sent messengers therefore unto Balaam the son of Beor to Pethor, which is by the river of the land of the children of his people, to call him, saying, Behold, there is a people come out from Egypt: behold, they cover the face of the earth, and they abide over against me:

verses.name: Numbers 22:6
verses.text: Come now therefore, I pray thee, curse me this people; for they are too mighty for me: peradventure I shall prevail, that we may smite them, and that I may drive them out of the land: for I wot that he whom thou blessest is blessed, and he whom thou cursest is cursed.

verses.name: Numbers 22:7
verses.text: And the elders of Moab and the elders of Midian departed with the rewards of divination in their hand; and they came unto Balaam, and spake unto him the words of Balak.

verses.name: Numbers 22:8
verses.text: And he said unto them, Lodge here this night, and I will bring you word again, as the Lord shall speak unto me: and the princes of Moab abode with Balaam.

verses.name: Numbers 22:9
verses.text: And God came unto Balaam, and said, What men are these with thee?

verses.name: Numbers 22:10
verses.text: And Balaam said unto God, Balak the son of Zippor, king of Moab, hath sent unto me, saying,

verses.name: Numbers 22:11
verses.text: Behold, there is a people come out of Egypt, which covereth the face of the earth: come now, curse me them; peradventure I shall be able to overcome them, and drive them out.

verses.name: Numbers 22:12
verses.text: And God said unto Balaam, Thou shalt not go with them; thou shalt not curse the people: for they are blessed.

verses.name: Numbers 22:13
verses.text: And Balaam rose up in the morning, and said unto the princes of Balak, Get you into your land: for the Lord refuseth to give me leave to go with you.

verses.name: Numbers 22:14
verses.text: And the princes of Moab rose up, and they went unto Balak, and said, Balaam refuseth to come with us.

verses.name: Numbers 22:15
verses.text: And Balak sent yet again princes, more, and more honourable than they.

verses.name: Numbers 22:16
verses.text: And they came to Balaam, and said to him, Thus saith Balak the son of Zippor, Let nothing, I pray thee, hinder thee from coming unto me:

verses.name: Numbers 22:17
verses.text: For I will promote thee unto very great honour, and I will do whatsoever thou sayest unto me: come therefore, I pray thee, curse me this people.

verses.name: Numbers 22:18
verses.text: And Balaam answered and said unto the servants of Balak, If Balak would give me his house full of silver and gold, I cannot go beyond the word of the Lord my God, to do less or more.

verses.name: Numbers 22:19
verses.text: Now therefore, I pray you, tarry ye also here this night, that I may know what the Lord will say unto me more.

verses.name: Numbers 22:20
verses.text: And God came unto Balaam at night, and said unto him, If the men come to call thee, rise up, and go with them; but yet the word which I shall say unto thee, that shalt thou do.

verses.name: Numbers 22:21
verses.text: And Balaam rose up in the morning, and saddled his ass, and went with the princes of Moab.

verses.name: Numbers 22:22
verses.text: And God’s anger was kindled because he went: and the angel of the Lord stood in the way for an adversary against him. Now he was riding upon his ass, and his two servants were with him.

verses.name: Numbers 22:23
verses.text: And the ass saw the angel of the Lord standing in the way, and his sword drawn in his hand: and the ass turned aside out of the way, and went into the field: and Balaam smote the ass, to turn her into the way.

verses.name: Numbers 22:24
verses.text: But the angel of the Lord stood in a path of the vineyards, a wall being on this side, and a wall on that side.

verses.name: Numbers 22:25
verses.text: And when the ass saw the angel of the Lord, she thrust herself unto the wall, and crushed Balaam’s foot against the wall: and he smote her again.

verses.name: Numbers 22:26
verses.text: And the angel of the Lord went further, and stood in a narrow place, where was no way to turn either to the right hand or to the left.

verses.name: Numbers 22:27
verses.text: And when the ass saw the angel of the Lord, she fell down under Balaam: and Balaam’s anger was kindled, and he smote the ass with a staff.

verses.name: Numbers 22:28
verses.text: And the Lord opened the mouth of the ass, and she said unto Balaam, What have I done unto thee, that thou hast smitten me these three times?

verses.name: Numbers 22:29
verses.text: And Balaam said unto the ass, Because thou hast mocked me: I would there were a sword in mine hand, for now would I kill thee.

verses.name: Numbers 22:30
verses.text: And the ass said unto Balaam, Am not I thine ass, upon which thou hast ridden ever since I was thine unto this day? was I ever wont to do so unto thee? And he said, Nay.

verses.name: Numbers 22:31
verses.text: Then the Lord opened the eyes of Balaam, and he saw the angel of the Lord standing in the way, and his sword drawn in his hand: and he bowed down his head, and fell flat on his face.

verses.name: Numbers 22:32
verses.text: And the angel of the Lord said unto him, Wherefore hast thou smitten thine ass these three times? behold, I went out to withstand thee, because thy way is perverse before me:

verses.name: Numbers 22:33
verses.text: And the ass saw me, and turned from me these three times: unless she had turned from me, surely now also I had slain thee, and saved her alive.

verses.name: Numbers 22:34
verses.text: And Balaam said unto the angel of the Lord, I have sinned; for I knew not that thou stoodest in the way against me: now therefore, if it displease thee, I will get me back again.

verses.name: Numbers 22:35
verses.text: And the angel of the Lord said unto Balaam, Go with the men: but only the word that I shall speak unto thee, that thou shalt speak. So Balaam went with the princes of Balak.

verses.name: Numbers 22:36
verses.text: And when Balak heard that Balaam was come, he went out to meet him unto a city of Moab, which is in the border of Arnon, which is in the utmost coast.

verses.name: Numbers 22:37
verses.text: And Balak said unto Balaam, Did I not earnestly send unto thee to call thee? wherefore camest thou not unto me? am I not able indeed to promote thee to honour?

verses.name: Numbers 22:38
verses.text: And Balaam said unto Balak, Lo, I am come unto thee: have I now any power at all to say any thing? the word that God putteth in my mouth, that shall I speak.

verses.name: Numbers 22:39
verses.text: And Balaam went with Balak, and they came unto Kirjath–huzoth.

verses.name: Numbers 22:40
verses.text: And Balak offered oxen and sheep, and sent to Balaam, and to the princes that were with him.

verses.name: Numbers 22:41
verses.text: And it came to pass on the morrow, that Balak took Balaam, and brought him up into the high places of Baal, that thence he might see the utmost part of the people.

verses.name: Numbers 23:1
verses.text: And Balaam said unto Balak, Build me here seven altars, and prepare me here seven oxen and seven rams.

verses.name: Numbers 23:2
verses.text: And Balak did as Balaam had spoken; and Balak and Balaam offered on every altar a bullock and a ram.

verses.name: Numbers 23:3
verses.text: And Balaam said unto Balak, Stand by thy burnt offering, and I will go: peradventure the Lord will come to meet me: and whatsoever he sheweth me I will tell thee. And he went to an high place.

verses.name: Numbers 23:4
verses.text: And God met Balaam: and he said unto him, I have prepared seven altars, and I have offered upon every altar a bullock and a ram.

verses.name: Numbers 23:5
verses.text: And the Lord put a word in Balaam’s mouth, and said, Return unto Balak, and thus thou shalt speak.

verses.name: Numbers 23:6
verses.text: And he returned unto him, and, lo, he stood by his burnt sacrifice, he, and all the princes of Moab.

verses.name: Numbers 23:7
verses.text: And he took up his parable, and said, Balak the king of Moab hath brought me from Aram, out of the mountains of the east, saying, Come, curse me Jacob, and come, defy Israel.

verses.name: Numbers 23:8
verses.text: How shall I curse, whom God hath not cursed? or how shall I defy, whom the Lord hath not defied?

verses.name: Numbers 23:9
verses.text: For from the top of the rocks I see him, and from the hills I behold him: lo, the people shall dwell alone, and shall not be reckoned among the nations.

verses.name: Numbers 23:10
verses.text: Who can count the dust of Jacob, and the number of the fourth part of Israel? Let me die the death of the righteous, and let my last end be like his!

verses.name: Numbers 23:11
verses.text: And Balak said unto Balaam, What hast thou done unto me? I took thee to curse mine enemies, and, behold, thou hast blessed them altogether.

verses.name: Numbers 23:12
verses.text: And he answered and said, Must I not take heed to speak that which the Lord hath put in my mouth?

verses.name: Numbers 23:13
verses.text: And Balak said unto him, Come, I pray thee, with me unto another place, from whence thou mayest see them: thou shalt see but the utmost part of them, and shalt not see them all: and curse me them from thence.

verses.name: Numbers 23:14
verses.text: And he brought him into the field of Zophim, to the top of Pisgah, and built seven altars, and offered a bullock and a ram on every altar.

verses.name: Numbers 23:15
verses.text: And he said unto Balak, Stand here by thy burnt offering, while I meet the Lord yonder.

verses.name: Numbers 23:16
verses.text: And the Lord met Balaam, and put a word in his mouth, and said, Go again unto Balak, and say thus.

verses.name: Numbers 23:17
verses.text: And when he came to him, behold, he stood by his burnt offering, and the princes of Moab with him. And Balak said unto him, What hath the Lord spoken?

verses.name: Numbers 23:18
verses.text: And he took up his parable, and said, Rise up, Balak, and hear; hearken unto me, thou son of Zippor:

verses.name: Numbers 23:19
verses.text: God is not a man, that he should lie; neither the son of man, that he should repent: hath he said, and shall he not do it? or hath he spoken, and shall he not make it good?

verses.name: Numbers 23:20
verses.text: Behold, I have received commandment to bless: and he hath blessed; and I cannot reverse it.

verses.name: Numbers 23:21
verses.text: He hath not beheld iniquity in Jacob, neither hath he seen perverseness in Israel: the Lord his God is with him, and the shout of a king is among them.

verses.name: Numbers 23:22
verses.text: God brought them out of Egypt; he hath as it were the strength of an unicorn.

verses.name: Numbers 23:23
verses.text: Surely there is no enchantment against Jacob, neither is there any divination against Israel: according to this time it shall be said of Jacob and of Israel, What hath God wrought!

verses.name: Numbers 23:24
verses.text: Behold, the people shall rise up as a great lion, and lift up himself as a young lion: he shall not lie down until he eat of the prey, and drink the blood of the slain.

verses.name: Numbers 23:25
verses.text: And Balak said unto Balaam, Neither curse them at all, nor bless them at all.

verses.name: Numbers 23:26
verses.text: But Balaam answered and said unto Balak, Told not I thee, saying, All that the Lord speaketh, that I must do?

verses.name: Numbers 23:27
verses.text: And Balak said unto Balaam, Come, I pray thee, I will bring thee unto another place; peradventure it will please God that thou mayest curse me them from thence.

verses.name: Numbers 23:28
verses.text: And Balak brought Balaam unto the top of Peor, that looketh toward Jeshimon.

verses.name: Numbers 23:29
verses.text: And Balaam said unto Balak, Build me here seven altars, and prepare me here seven bullocks and seven rams.

verses.name: Numbers 23:30
verses.text: And Balak did as Balaam had said, and offered a bullock and a ram on every altar.

verses.name: Numbers 24:1
verses.text: And when Balaam saw that it pleased the Lord to bless Israel, he went not, as at other times, to seek for enchantments, but he set his face toward the wilderness.

verses.name: Numbers 24:2
verses.text: And Balaam lifted up his eyes, and he saw Israel abiding in his tents according to their tribes; and the spirit of God came upon him.

verses.name: Numbers 24:3
verses.text: And he took up his parable, and said, Balaam the son of Beor hath said, and the man whose eyes are open hath said:

verses.name: Numbers 24:4
verses.text: He hath said, which heard the words of God, which saw the vision of the Almighty, falling into a trance, but having his eyes open:

verses.name: Numbers 24:5
verses.text: How goodly are thy tents, O Jacob, and thy tabernacles, O Israel!

verses.name: Numbers 24:6
verses.text: As the valleys are they spread forth, as gardens by the river’s side, as the trees of lign aloes which the Lord hath planted, and as cedar trees beside the waters.

verses.name: Numbers 24:7
verses.text: He shall pour the water out of his buckets, and his seed shall be in many waters, and his king shall be higher than Agag, and his kingdom shall be exalted.

verses.name: Numbers 24:8
verses.text: God brought him forth out of Egypt; he hath as it were the strength of an unicorn: he shall eat up the nations his enemies, and shall break their bones, and pierce them through with his arrows.

verses.name: Numbers 24:9
verses.text: He couched, he lay down as a lion, and as a great lion: who shall stir him up? Blessed is he that blesseth thee, and cursed is he that curseth thee.

verses.name: Numbers 24:10
verses.text: And Balak’s anger was kindled against Balaam, and he smote his hands together: and Balak said unto Balaam, I called thee to curse mine enemies, and, behold, thou hast altogether blessed them these three times.

verses.name: Numbers 24:11
verses.text: Therefore now flee thou to thy place: I thought to promote thee unto great honour; but, lo, the Lord hath kept thee back from honour.

verses.name: Numbers 24:12
verses.text: And Balaam said unto Balak, Spake I not also to thy messengers which thou sentest unto me, saying,

verses.name: Numbers 24:13
verses.text: If Balak would give me his house full of silver and gold, I cannot go beyond the commandment of the Lord, to do either good or bad of mine own mind; but what the Lord saith, that will I speak?

verses.name: Numbers 24:14
verses.text: And now, behold, I go unto my people: come therefore, and I will advertise thee what this people shall do to thy people in the latter days.

verses.name: Numbers 24:15
verses.text: And he took up his parable, and said, Balaam the son of Beor hath said, and the man whose eyes are open hath said:

verses.name: Numbers 24:16
verses.text: He hath said, which heard the words of God, and knew the knowledge of the most High, which saw the vision of the Almighty, falling into a trance, but having his eyes open:

verses.name: Numbers 24:17
verses.text: I shall see him, but not now: I shall behold him, but not nigh: there shall come a Star out of Jacob, and a Sceptre shall rise out of Israel, and shall smite the corners of Moab, and destroy all the children of Sheth.

verses.name: Numbers 24:18
verses.text: And Edom shall be a possession, Seir also shall be a possession for his enemies; and Israel shall do valiantly.

verses.name: Numbers 24:19
verses.text: Out of Jacob shall come he that shall have dominion, and shall destroy him that remaineth of the city.

verses.name: Numbers 24:20
verses.text: And when he looked on Amalek, he took up his parable, and said, Amalek was the first of the nations; but his latter end shall be that he perish for ever.

verses.name: Numbers 24:21
verses.text: And he looked on the Kenites, and took up his parable, and said, Strong is thy dwellingplace, and thou puttest thy nest in a rock.

verses.name: Numbers 24:22
verses.text: Nevertheless the Kenite shall be wasted, until Asshur shall carry thee away captive.

verses.name: Numbers 24:23
verses.text: And he took up his parable, and said, Alas, who shall live when God doeth this!

verses.name: Numbers 24:24
verses.text: And ships shall come from the coast of Chittim, and shall afflict Asshur, and shall afflict Eber, and he also shall perish for ever.

verses.name: Numbers 24:25
verses.text: And Balaam rose up, and went and returned to his place: and Balak also went his way.

verses.name: Numbers 25:1
verses.text: And Israel abode in Shittim, and the people began to commit whoredom with the daughters of Moab.

verses.name: Numbers 25:2
verses.text: And they called the people unto the sacrifices of their gods: and the people did eat, and bowed down to their gods.

verses.name: Numbers 25:3
verses.text: And Israel joined himself unto Baal–peor: and the anger of the Lord was kindled against Israel.

verses.name: Numbers 25:4
verses.text: And the Lord said unto Moses, Take all the heads of the people, and hang them up before the Lord against the sun, that the fierce anger of the Lord may be turned away from Israel.

verses.name: Numbers 25:5
verses.text: And Moses said unto the judges of Israel, Slay ye every one his men that were joined unto Baal–peor.

verses.name: Numbers 25:6
verses.text: And, behold, one of the children of Israel came and brought unto his brethren a Midianitish woman in the sight of Moses, and in the sight of all the congregation of the children of Israel, who were weeping before the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.

verses.name: Numbers 25:7
verses.text: And when Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, saw it, he rose up from among the congregation, and took a javelin in his hand;

verses.name: Numbers 25:8
verses.text: And he went after the man of Israel into the tent, and thrust both of them through, the man of Israel, and the woman through her belly. So the plague was stayed from the children of Israel.

verses.name: Numbers 25:9
verses.text: And those that died in the plague were twenty and four thousand.

verses.name: Numbers 25:10
verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,

verses.name: Numbers 25:11
verses.text: Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, hath turned my wrath away from the children of Israel, while he was zealous for my sake among them, that I consumed not the children of Israel in my jealousy.

verses.name: Numbers 25:12
verses.text: Wherefore say, Behold, I give unto him my covenant of peace:

verses.name: Numbers 25:13
verses.text: And he shall have it, and his seed after him, even the covenant of an everlasting priesthood; because he was zealous for his God, and made an atonement for the children of Israel.

verses.name: Numbers 25:14
verses.text: Now the name of the Israelite that was slain, even that was slain with the Midianitish woman, was Zimri, the son of Salu, a prince of a chief house among the Simeonites.

verses.name: Numbers 25:15
verses.text: And the name of the Midianitish woman that was slain was Cozbi, the daughter of Zur; he was head over a people, and of a chief house in Midian.

verses.name: Numbers 25:16
verses.text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,

verses.name: Numbers 25:17
verses.text: Vex the Midianites, and smite them:

verses.name: Numbers 25:18
verses.text: For they vex you with their wiles, wherewith they have beguiled you in the matter of Peor, and in the matter of Cozbi, the daughter of a prince of Midian, their sister, which was slain in the day of the plague for Peor’s sake.

verses.name: Numbers 26:1
verses.text: And it came to pass after the plague, that the Lord spake unto Moses and unto Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest, saying,
